physDesc.p: One page typewritten in black ink. Address given for H. D. in the top left corner of the first page: Mrs. Richard Aldington c/o Manager, Lloyd’s Bank 67 Kingsway London W.C.2 England. Unsigned. Includes an enclosure and a statement of royalties due to H.D.

editorialDecl.p: This letter contains references to the following:

body.p: This is only a hurried scrawl to send off your half-yearly royalties on the "Imagist Poets." They should have gone before, but I have been frightfully busy getting Mrs. Ayscough’s and my book of Chinese translations into the press, and I am equally breathless in my efforts to get it out again. But I cannot hold this cheque any longer; vast though it is, my conscience says it ought to go to you.

I hear from Winifred on occasion. It is too bad that they have refused her book. I wonder when yours is coming out. I have preempted it for the "New York Evening Post," but I have seen no announcements of it and I have no idea when it is due.

Since my operation, my work has been confined to these Chinese things, but once that book is out of the way, I shall tackle Keats in earnest. My lectures begin in November, but I feel better than I have for a long time and, although I do not permit myself to hope that I am cured, at any rate I am having a pleasant respite.
Where are you and what are you doing? I long to hear. And how is Perdita? I have no time for a longer letter, but you will know that this takes much love from both Mrs. Russell and me.
